Section.Catchline: Postpartum care for birth center clients and infants.

Subsection.Text: A mother and her infant shall be dismissed from the birth center within 24 hours after the birth of the infant, except in unusual circumstances as defined by rule of the agency. If a mother or infant is retained at the birth center for more than 24 hours after the birth, a report shall be filed with the agency within 48 hours of the birth describing the circumstances and the reasons for the decision.
A prophylactic shall be instilled in the eyes of each newborn in accordance with s. 383.04.
Postpartum evaluation and followup care shall be provided, which shall include:

Paragraph.Text: Metabolic screening tests required by s. 383.14.
Referral to sources for pediatric care.
Instruction in child care, including immunization and breastfeeding.
Referral to secondary or tertiary care, as indicated.
